title: Mini Projects (Combined Concepts)
concept: Final level for Python track. These problems combine input/output, conditions, loops, lists, strings, functions, dictionaries and basic classes into mini-project style tasks.

challenges.title: Student Marks Report
challenges.description: Read N and then N marks. Print three lines: highest mark, lowest mark, and average (integer division).
challenges.outputDescription:
Line1: highest
Line2: lowest
Line3: average
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
marks = list(map(int, input().split()))
# print highest, lowest, average

challenges.title: Pass & Fail Count
challenges.description: Pass mark is 40. Read N and N marks. Print two integers: pass_count and fail_count separated by space.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
marks = list(map(int, input().split()))
# count pass (>=40) and fail

challenges.title: String Analyzer
challenges.description: Read a sentence and print three lines: number of characters (including spaces), number of words, and number of vowels (a,e,i,o,u in both cases).
challenges.outputDescription:
Line1: char_count
Line2: word_count
Line3: vowel_count
challenges.starterCode:
s = input()
# compute char count, word count, vowel count

challenges.title: Matrix Addition
challenges.description: Read R, C and two matrices A and B of size R x C. Print matrix (A+B) with each row in one line and elements separated by space.
challenges.inputDescription: R C, then R lines of A, then R lines of B.
challenges.starterCode:
r, c = map(int, input().split())
A = [list(map(int, input().split())) for _ in range(r)]
B = [list(map(int, input().split())) for _ in range(r)]
# compute and print A+B

challenges.title: Matrix Transpose
challenges.description: Read R, C and an R x C matrix. Print its transpose (C x R) with each row on new line.
challenges.inputDescription: R C followed by R lines.
challenges.starterCode:
r, c = map(int, input().split())
A = [list(map(int, input().split())) for _ in range(r)]
# compute transpose and print

challenges.title: Binary to Decimal
challenges.description: Read a binary string (e.g., 1011) and convert it to decimal integer.
challenges.starterCode:
b = input().strip()
# convert binary string to decimal

challenges.title: Decimal to Binary
challenges.description: Read a non-negative integer n and print its binary representation (no leading zeros).
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
# convert decimal to binary (string) and print

challenges.title: Digit Frequency Report
challenges.description: Read a non-negative integer n. Count frequency of each digit 0â€“9 and print 10 lines in format d:count.

challenges.title: Mini Phonebook (Dict + Loop)
challenges.description: First read N. Then read N lines with name and number. Then read Q and Q query names. For each query, print the number if present else Not Found.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N lines name number, then Q, then Q names.
challenges.outputDescription: Q lines: number or Not Found.
examples:
Input:
2
Ram 999
Kiran 888
3
Kiran
Amit
Ram
Output:
888
Not Found
999
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
phone = {}
# read n entries
q = int(input())
# handle q queries

challenges.title: Student Result Summary
challenges.description: Build a mini result system. Read N. For each student, read name and 3 subject marks. Pass mark is 40 in each subject. Finally print three lines: total_students, pass_students, fail_students. A student passes only if all three marks >= 40.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N lines: name m1 m2 m3.
challenges.outputDescription:
Line1: total
Line2: pass
Line3: fail
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
# read students, apply rule, count pass/fail
